title: 112_hr1829
content: The Act may be cited as the "Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2011". Section 2 of the Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to include other coastal States in addition to Maryland and Louisiana. The Act authorizes the Maryland Nutria Project, which has successfully eradicated nutria from over 130,000 acres of Chesapeake Bay wetlands. The Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 facilitated partnerships and landowner agreements to eradicate nutria in Maryland and reduce nutria-impacted wetlands in Louisiana. The techniques developed should be applied to other nutria-infested coastal States. The Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 aims to provide financial assistance to certain states to eradicate or control nutria and restore nutria damaged wetlands. The Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to redefine sections and insert new definitions. The Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to define key terms such as coastal state, program, public-private partnership, and Secretary. The act also establishes a nutria eradication program. Section 4 of the Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to provide financial assistance to Maryland and Louisiana for nutria eradication and wetlands restoration. The amendments also specify the involvement of coastal states in implementing these measures. The Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to provide financial assistance to Maryland for wetlands restoration. The amendments also specify the involvement of coastal states in implementing these measures. The Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to provide financial assistance to Maryland for wetlands restoration, with specified involvement of coastal states. SEC. 5. REPORT. Section 5 of the Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003 is amended to update eradication strategies for Nutria in the Chesapeake and Delaware Bay Watersheds. The amendment includes continuing development in cooperation with the State of Delaware Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control. The Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control, along with other state departments, are implementing long-term nutria control programs to reduce damage to coastal wetlands and promote partnerships for restoration.
